name: The Modern Honolulu

reviews.title: Mod
reviews.text: Got a good deal with one of those bid sites. Two adults and two kids (8 and 22). Not our typical style, but worked out very well. The hotel is good, pool small but warm, service great. Morimoto's restaurant is great and may set the tone for the whole hotel. Thanks.

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.text: The rooms were quite appealing to the eye. The bed was very comfortable. I was on the fifth floor and could hear and feel the music from the nightclub below till 3 am each night. Had to have a maintenance technician come fix my aircoditioner due to a loud noise it was making. He arrived immediately after the call and was quick and professional. Nice pool and pool atmosphere. Checking in took forever. The gym was appropriately equipped. Overall not a bad place if you can get a high floor.

reviews.title: URBAN RESORT IS CODE FOR LOCATED IN NOISEY AREA AND NOT ON A BEACH
reviews.text: I am updating a previous review I did in October.

reviews.title: Good hotel, but wifi is super slow
reviews.text: While the pictures you see on their website indicate a fantastic, serene location, I had the opportunity to take some photos from a condominium complex that towers over the MODERN. The hotel is the white building that in the center that is bordered by the the noisiest intersection in Waikiki (Ala Moana Blvd and Hobron Ave.) To the left is the Ilikai Hotel and behind is the muddy Ala Wai Harbor. The two pools in the center are indeed the property's pools. The round one is their "sunset private beach" because their is sand around the pool.

reviews.title: I really liked it!
reviews.text: Noise is the major issue. Because of the location you are subjected to endless traffic, sirens, construction and loud people from the property's nightclub.......at 2-3am. The roooms are okay and the service is too. But this is not a relaxing place to stay no matter how nice their website photos appear. Their advertising says "Urban Resort". That is code for "A hotel in the middle of a cluttered area that is not on a beach". They are charging 5 star resort prices for a 3 star "urban" hotel.

we booked this through bookit.com and found out this was the place after I made the reservation...it's a 4 star place and we absolutely loved it!! we parked our rental across the road on hebron? ave/st and it cost us $20/day/24 hour and was cheaper than valet and having to tip and wait for your car when you can take the skywalk over to your car and no hassles...the room was very clean and very nice...we had a 2 double bed city/partial water view and it was really a pleasant place...when we arrived at 1pm the small young woman that signed us in wasn't helpful at all and was willing to have us walk around waikiki beach with our luggage for an hour until the room on the upper floor was ready but the supervisor Steve overheard and was our saving grace as he went up personally and checked on two other rooms and released them and let us go to our room then...THANK YOU STEVE!!! we really appreciated him...she on the other hand probably could us some customer service lessons, and smiling is free!! very nice room, nice pool, nice hotel all around!! they have nightly turn down service too!

reviews.text: We have just returned from our two week honeymoon in Waikiki and thanks to the Modern Honolulu, we haven't stopped raving about the place. Our first week was at ther Sheraton Waikiki and it was old, crowded, uncomfortable, expensive, central but not relaxing. We wished we had booked at the Modern for our entire stay. The location is perfect, just a short 10min beachfront walk to the hub of Waikiki, just a 5 min walk to Ala Moana, overlooking the sea, Marina and pools - simply dreamy. The Modern Honolulu stands up to everything of it's name. The rooms are spacious, totally renovated, quiet and 'modern'. The pools are divine, and you can always find a pool lounge without paying extra (not like the Sheraton). The food is beautiful, good quality produce, australian standard / size and all comes from chef Morimoto's kitchen (aka iron chef). It's stunningly simple and beautiful, not crowded, classy, great value, quiet, convenient, spacious and most importantly relaxing. The perfect honeymoon destination. We loved this resort so much, we're already planning our next trip back. We've stayed in 5 star resorts all over the world and The Modern Waikiki is Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Best resort in Waikiki

reviews.text: The hotel looks pretty cool inside, everyone is sort of like a stepford service staff, wearing white and always smiling... but it is only skin deep. The resort's location is the noisy hotel I have ever experienced. They were doing maintenance at 4 AM. I was awakened twice in the middle of the night by garbage trucks and spraying of sidewalks with pressure sprayers. The carpet had stains that had not been adequately cleaned. Vallet drivers were more than happy to take your car and peel out in front of other guest, smiling and laughing the entire time. Don't be fooled by the photos. This is not an upscale resort. It is an old resort that has been renovated and is trying to be upscale and hip. It doesn't measure up. This was my worst travel experience of the year. I have stayed is better Marriott Courtyards.
reviews.title: Noisy, Poor Service, WannaBe Upscale Experience

reviews.text: The staff did finally move me to a higher floor where I could not hear the street noise. I recommend if you stay here that you request a very high floor and that you don't expect to have an upscale experience. They are still working to get things right.
reviews.title: call it 4.5*

reviews.text: Relaxing, pleasant, stylish but not over-the-top. They seem to be trying to push to the 5* level, but there is just a bit of hardware missing: rooms lack bathtubs, though the walk-in showers are good (water pressure on my upper floor was a little low). No locker rooms, but a decent fitness center and an acceptable pool (they might renovate it for lap-swimmers to share with the lounge-swimmers, though). Nice (and good looking) staff. Very clean; good-sized rooms. The platform beds would make me think twice about bringing the kids, is all. Yes, lack of coffee in the rooms is an annoyance, though if you're not fussy you can bring in an emergency can from the ABC across the street. I found the "iron chef" restaurant noisy and crowded at night (and didn't go), but the Japanese breakfast was quite fine.

reviews.text: Our stay at The Modern was fabulous! We loved every minute and wish we had stayed here earlier in our trip to Hawaii. I have nothing but praise for the hotel and its staff - I am completely baffled by many of the reviews posted here....can they be real???!!
reviews.title: Amazing!
Very Strange Hotel...beware of "Resort" status on Priceline
reviews.text: We had booked our room (city view) direct through the hotel and we got an already great rate (inc. parking). We arrived around midday and we were kindly allowed to check in right away. We were upgraded to an ocean view room which was just beautiful. Amazing views and the decor and design of the room was gorgeous, very fresh, neutral and so relaxing....it was hard to leave the room!

The hotel lobby, pool areas, lounge areas, etc. were all gorgeous and extremely well tended to. We spent many hours by the pool drinking lava flows, floating on the pool lilos and totally winding down. We enjoyed the 'beach' area up top and thought this was a nice area to relax by and thought it would be especially great if you had small children. The main pool has underwater speakers - a very cool touch! This area was just a great spot to hang by day, by night and especially in between at sunset (breathtaking!)
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: The staff were all fabulous. From the moment we pulled up, everyone we encountered were extremely polite and helpful - from the check it, to the pool area, to the housekeeping staff. It is so nice to stay in a hotel where everyone is so friendly and respectful.

description: THE MODERN HONOLULU introduces cosmopolitan chic for leisure and business pursuits in Hawaii. We deftly combine sexy and sophisticated in everything we do. Every element is original; authentic or custom-designed to enhance your experience. Gourmet pleasures, vibrant nightlife, intimate pool settings, exhilarating spa treatments and all that Oahu has to offer - luxury shopping, beaches, nature - blend to create a feeling of progressive luxury, as refined as it is relaxed. We invite you to make the most of every moment with us.
